sentences.sContent: Somewhat less than 40% of people in the world retain the ability to digest lactose after childhood.
sentences.sContent_eng: Somewhat less than 40% of people in the world retain the ability to digest lactose after childhood.
sentences.sCn: 全世界大约不到40%的成年人能够在童年过后保留消化乳糖的能力。

sentences.sContent: With sugar malabsorption, intestinal mucosal enzymes, such as lactase, which splits lactose to galactose and glucose, may be congenitally absent or temporarily deficient secondary to GI infection.
sentences.sContent_eng: With sugar malabsorption, intestinal mucosal enzymes, such as lactase, which splits lactose to galactose and glucose, may be congenitally absent or temporarily deficient secondary to GI infection.
sentences.sCn: 糖吸收不良：小肠粘膜酶，如乳糖酶能将乳糖分解成半乳糖和葡萄糖，可能是先天缺失或因胃肠感染引起暂时不足。

sentences.sContent: To promote the production and consumption of milk, it is necessary to produce and popularize low lactose milk.
sentences.sContent_eng: To promote the production and consumption of milk, it is necessary to produce and popularize low lactose milk.
sentences.sCn: 为了实现人们“想喝奶和多喝奶”的愿望，进行低乳糖奶的生产和推广成为必然。

trans.tranOther: a type of sugar found in milk, sometimes used as a food for babies and sick people
